alert.note: Alert for Mahaska (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Mahaska County through 645 PM CDT... At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Oskaloosa, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Mahaska County, including the following locations... Keomah Village, Lake Keomah State Park and Rose Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central Iowa.
